<h1>Nepal Tibet Tour Package</h1>
<p><span><a href="/" title="Home">Home</a> » <a href="/international-tours" title="International Tour Packages">International</a> » <a href="/nepal-tour-packages" title="Nepal Tour Packages">Nepal</a> » <span class="breadcrumb_last" aria-current="page">Nepal Tibet Tour Package</span></span></p>
</div>

</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div id="cmsmasters_row_673c332633a1c8_11860227" class="cmsmasters_row cmsmasters_color_scheme_default tourflexBox cmsmasters_row_top_default cmsmasters_row_bot_default cmsmasters_row_boxed">
<div id="tourflexBox2" class="cmsmasters_row_outer_parent">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_outer">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_inner">
<div class="cmsmasters_row_margin">
<div class="cmsmasters_column two_third">
<div class="custom_html tourIB1">
<div class="proGall"><img decoding="async" src="/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/nepal-tibet-tour.jpg" alt="Nepal Tibet Tour Package" title="Nepal Tibet Tour Package" width="750" height="450" loading="lazy"></div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB2">
<div class="tour-overview">
<div class="toBt"><i class="fa fa-file"></i> Tour Overview</div>
<p>Nepal Tibet tour package is designed in such a way that you can explore the beautiful landscapes and the diverse climatic conditions of both the countries. You can also explore some of the ancient narrow lanes of the capital city of Nepal. Visiting some oldest temples, forts, and Stupas will be a complimentary benefit of this package. You are also going to explore some of the most happening wildlife sanctuaries of these two countries.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB4">
<div class="tour-collection">
<h2 class="tourDBox"><i class="fa fa-bus" aria-hidden="true"></i> Nepal Tibet Tour Itinerary Package</h2>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details" id="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 1 :</span>Delhi</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="">
<p>Upon your arrival at the Delhi Airport, our team representative will greet you and then take you to our listed hotel. Check- in at the hotel and then rest for some hours. In the evening, you can go on a walk to explore the beautiful nightlife of the city. Return to the hotel and then enjoy your dinner.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 2 :</span>Delhi Excursion</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Start your day with a hearty breakfast and then set out for exploring some of the most famous tourist destinations in Delhi including Humayun’s Tomb. If time allows then do not skip the light and sound show at Red Fort. Return to the hotel and enjoy a healthy dinner and then stay there overnight.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 3 :</span>Delhi – Agra – Delhi</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After the morning meal, you will be taken to New Delhi Railway Station to get the train to Agra. Upon your arrival at the Taj Mahal City, you will be set out free to explore all the surreal beauties of Agra like Red Fort, Panch Mahal, Taj Mahal (reckoned as the seventh wonder of the world), Ram Bagh, Fatehpur Sikri, etc. After visiting all the tourist places in Agra, you will be taken to Agra Railway Station from where you get the return train to Delhi. You must be tired so enjoy the sumptuous night meal and then sleep.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 4 :</span>Delhi – Kathmandu</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Next morning, you will drive towards Delhi Airport to take the flight to Kathmandu. Upon your arrival at Kathmandu Airport, our team representative will escort you to the pre-booked hotel. Check-in at the hotel and relax for some hours and then late on in the evening, go and explore the awe-inspiring nightlife of the capital city of Nepal. Return to the hotel and then stay there overnight.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 5 :</span>Kathmandu</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Post breakfast, step out of the hotel to explore Boudhanath Temple which is one of the most visited and liked places by tourists in Kathmandu. Later on, in the afternoon go on a visit to Swayambhunath Temple which is located on the top of the hill. If time permits then do explore Garden of Dreams which is located in the centre of Kathmandu.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 6 :</span>Kathmandu</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Next morning, visit Pashupatinath Temple and the prayer ceremonies at this ancient temple of Lord Shiva. Afterward, return to the hotel and enjoy the morning meal and then proceed for the next visit of the day at Kumari Chowk. This is the place where Goddess Durga is worshipped as a small girl. Post visiting this sacred place return to the hotel and then overnight stay there.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 7 :</span>Kathmandu – Gorkha</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Post breakfast you will be driven towards Gorkha which is situated around 23 km away from the north of the road that links Kathmandu and Pokhara. After arriving at Gorkha, check-in at the hotel and then rest for a while. Later on, step out and explore some of the most acclaimed tourist spots in Gorkha including Uppalokot and Tallokot, Gorakhnath Cave Shrine, and Gorkha fortress.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 8 :</span>Gorkha – Pokhara</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After the hearty breakfast, you will be driven towards Pokhara which is a kind of blessing from nature and is known for its splendid landscapes. Upon arrival at Pokhara, check-in at the hotel and then move out to explore the famous Barahi Temple. Later on, drive further to explore the majestic views of the Himalayan Ranges. If time allows then visit the two beautiful lakes at Pokhara – Begnas and Rupa. After the city excursion, return to the hotel and then overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 9 :</span>Pokhara</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>In the morning, you will be taken to the first sightseeing destination of the day at Pokhara at Phewa Lake where you can enjoy the boat ride. After the boat ride, you can show your faith and can pay homage at the ancient Tal Barahi Temple. Then in the afternoon, go and visit Mahendra Cave where you can find numerous idols of Hindu gods and goddesses. In the evening return to the hotel and then stay overnight.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 10 :</span>Pokhara – Tansen – Chitwan</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Next morning after breakfast you will be taken to Chitwan via Tansen which is quite perfect for short treks. Some of the major tourist attractions of the city are Srinagar Danda, Bhagwati Mandir, Amar Narayan Mandir, etc. Post Tansen excursion, we will drive towards Chitwan. Upon arrival at Chitwan, check-in at the pre-booked wildlife resort and then move out to explore the Chitwan National Park where you can enjoy the safari rides and also the elephant ride.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 11 :</span>Chitwan</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Move out from the hotel early morning and then proceed to explore the cascading waterfalls along with enjoying canoeing. You can pay your second visit to the huge Chitwan National Park which is home to a wide variety of flora and fauna species. If you get free early then you will be taken to the turtle and the crocodile breeding Centre. After exploring the breeding centre returns back to the hotel and then overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 12 :</span>Chitwan – Kathmandu</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Post-check-out in the morning we will drive towards Kathmandu and upon arrival, check-in at the hotel and relax in the Cozy ambiance of the hotel room. The day is all yours do whatever you like to. Have dinner at night and then stay overnight.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 13 :</span>Kathmandu – Lhasa – Tsedang</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Post breakfast we will drive to the Kathmandu Airport to take the flight to Lhasa. After reaching Lhasa, you will move towards Tsedang by car. Check-in at the hotel and relax for some hours. Later in the evening, you can go for a walk around Tsedang.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 14 :</span>Exploring Tsedang</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Early morning after breakfast explore the major attractions of the place including Trandruk Monastery, Samye Monastery and Relic of Lhagyari Palace. After Tsedang excursion return back to the hotel in the evening, have dinner and then overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 15 :</span>Tsedang – Gyantse</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Post breakfast drives straight towards Gyantse which connects Kathmandu with Lhasa. Upon arrival at Gyantse, check-in at the hotel and rest for a while. Later on, move out to visit the Kumbum Monastery of six floors housing 77 chapels. If time permits then go to explore some other monasteries and tourist spots in the city.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 16 :</span>Gyantse – Shigatse</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Next morning post breakfast we will move towards Shigatse. After reaching the city, check-in at the hotel and relax for a while. After the day meal, come out of the hotel for a short sightseeing trip of the city. Explore Mangpu Hot Spring, Potala Palace, Mount Cho Oyu, and the Pelkor Monastery. Return to the hotel in the Evening, enjoy the sumptuous meal and then overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 17 :</span>Shigatse – Lhasa</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Post breakfast in the morning, we will drive towards Lhasa, and en-route Lhasa you will see the Brahmaputra River. You can also see some mountain sheep, busy villages, yaks while crossing the distance. After reaching Lhasa, check-in at the hotel, enjoy the night meal and then stay overnight.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 18 :</span>Lhasa</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After a healthy breakfast, you will set out for the sightseeing tour of the city where you can some outstanding beauties of Lhasa city like Drepung, Sera Monastery, Potala Palace, etc.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 19 :</span>Lhasa</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Next morning after the morning meal you will be transferred to some other major attractions of the Lhasa city which you couldn’t explore last day like Namtso Lake whose surroundings are quite appealing and admiring.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 20 :</span>Lhasa – Kathmandu – Delhi</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Early morning after check-out from the hotel you will be transferred to Kathmandu Airport to take the flight to Delhi. Upon arrival at Delhi, you will be taken to the hotel to change and get refreshed. Later in the evening, after dinner, you will be transferred to Delhi Airport where our tour representative bids you adieu for your onward journey back home.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="custom_html tourIB8">
<div id="popularBox8" class="tour-collection">
<h3><i class="fa fa-question-circle" aria-hidden="true"></i> FAQs for Nepal Tibet Package</h3>
<div class="panel-body">
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Are Some Interesting Facts About Tibet And Nepal?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> While Tibet has a high plateau with an average elevation of over 4,000 metres, Nepal has a wide range of elevations from north to south. The majority of Tibet is at altitudes ranging from 3,500 metres to 5,500 metres, and for most visitors, this small difference in altitude is all they will notice.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is Tibet Most Famous For?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Tibet is famous for its sacred mountains and lakes. It is a land of high mountains and enormous lakes, all of which have religious or sacred significance in Tibetan religion and culture. The Great Three Holy Lakes of Tibet are the most sacred of the lakes: Lake Manasarovar, Lake Yamdrok, and Lake Namtso.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Which Animal Can Only Be Found In Nepal?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> The only endemic species in Nepal is the spiny babbler.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Kind Of Food Do The People Of Nepal Eat?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Nepali staples include rice, wheat, maize and lentils, as well as fresh vegetables and meats. A typical Nepali daily meal consists of Dal (lentil soups), Bhat (steamed rice), and Tarkari (vegetable preparations), also known as "The Trinity," and may include some meat preparation.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is Nepal's National Sweet?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Sel roti is a delicacy made primarily for the major Nepali festivals of Dashain and Tihar. It is unique to Nepal and has become an iconic symbol of Nepali culture and festivities; it is made and served throughout the country during festivals, weddings, and other ceremonies.</p>
</p></div></div></div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
